text: In order to study <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene regulation , the human <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene was cloned from a partial <extra_id_0> EcoRI <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> digested chromosome 5 library .
A 5.5-kilobase genomic clone contained the full-length <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> coding sequence and 4.2 kilobases of 5' - upstream sequence .
One major and one minor transcription start site were identified 101 and 130 base pairs ( bp ) upstream , respectively , from the protein translation start ATG .

A DNA fragment containing 128 bp of upstream sequence had strong , monocyte - specific promoter activity in the <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> positive monocytic cell line Mono Mac 6 as compared to the nonmonocytic cell lines HeLa and REX .
Four regions in this DNA fragment interact with nuclear proteins isolated from monocytic cells .
